description: Gandalf arrives in Hobbiton to warn Frodo
Sauron’s assault on Osgiliath. Thranduli’s halls are are attacked, allowing Gollum to escape.
Boromir rides from Minas Tirith toward Rivendell.
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman in Orthanc.
Gandalf escapes Saruman’s captivity in Orthanc before dawn, the Black Riders cross over the Fords of Isen.
Gandalf, arriving as a beggar, is refused entry to Edoras.
Gandalf enters Edoras, but is commanded by King Theoden to take any horse and leave.
Shadowfax will not permit Gandalf to approach him, so Gandalf follows him over the fields of Rohan.
Gandalf passes Shadowfax. The Black Riders arrive at Sarn Ford in the evening and drive off the Rangers.

Gandalf rides a tamed Shadowfax from Rohan. Four of the Black Riders pass into the Shire ere dawn, and the rest pursue the Rangers to the east before returning to watch the Greenway. One arrives enters Hobbiton at sundown. Frodo departs Bag End at night, beginning his journey.
Gandalf crosses over the River Isen. Frodo and company cross paths with two Black Riders, and spend the night with Gildor and the High Elves near the Woody End.
Frodo and company pass through Farmer Maggot’s farm, cross over the Brandywine River, and arrive at Crickhollow at night.
Frodo and company pass through the Old Forest and meet Tom Bombadil.
Gandalf crosses over the Greyflood, and Frodo and company spends a second night with Tom Bombadil.
Gandalf arrives at Sarn Ford, and Frodo and company are taken captive by a Barrow-wight.
Gandalf speaks with the Gaffer, and Frodo and company arrive at Bree in the evening.
Both Crickhollow and the Prancing Pony Inn at Bree are raided by Black Riders before dawn. Frodo and company depart Bree, and Gandalf arrives at Crickhollow before making it to Bree after sundown.
Gandalf departs from Bree.
Gandalf is attacked on Weathertop at night by Black Riders.
Frodo and company’s camp beneath Weathertop is attacked at night. Frodo is wounded by the Witch-King’s with a Morgul-knife.
Glorfindel departs Rivendell.
Glorfindel drives the Black Riders from the Bridge of Mitheithel.
Frodo and company pass over the Bridge of Mitheithel.
Glorfindel finds Frodo and company at dusk, and Gandalf arrives in Rivendell.
Glorfindel and Frodo escape over the Ford of Bruinen.
Frodo recovers and awakes in Rivendell, and Boromir arrives in Rivendell after sunset.
The Council of Elrond is held to decide what to do with the Ring.
The Fellowship of the Ring are chosen.
The Fellowship depart Rivendell at dusk.
The Fellowship come to Hollin.
The Fellowship face snow on the Redhorn Pass beneath Mount Caradhras.
The Fellowship are turned back by the snow on the Redhorn Pass.
The Fellowship are attacked by Wolves before sunrise, and arrive at the West-gate of Moria at sunset. Gollum begins to follow Frodo.
The Fellowship spend the night in Hall Twenty-One of Khazad-dûm.
The Fellowship cross the Bridge of Khazad-dûm, with Gandalf and the Balrog falling into the abyss below. The Fellowship reach Nimrodel long after sunset.
The Fellowship are brought to Caras Galadon in the evening.
Gandalf pursues the Balrog up the Endless Stair to the very peak of Zirak-zigil.
Gandalf defeats the Balrog and casts it down. He passes away, and his body lies on the peak of Zirak-zigil.
Frodo and Sam look into the Mirror of Galadriel. Gandalf returns to life, and lies on the peak of Zirak-zigil in a trance.
The Fellowship bid farewell to Lórien, and Gollum observes their departure from hiding on the west bank.
Gwaihir, lord of the Great Eagles, carries Gandalf to Lórien.
The Fellowship’s boats are attacked after dark near Sarn Gebir.
The Fellowship pass the Argonath and make camp at Parth Galen. Théodred son of Théoden is slain during the First Battle of the Fords of Isen.

The Breaking of the Fellowship. Boromir is slain by many arrows, and his horn is heard in Minas Tirith. Merry and Pippin are captured by Orcs, and Frodo and Sam pass into the eastern Emyn Muil. The Three Hunters Aragorn, Legolas, and Gimli, begin their pursuit of the Orcs by evening. Éomer learns of the Orcs descending from the Emyn Muil.
The Three Hunters summit the west-cliff at dawn. Éomer departs Eastfold around midnight to pursue the Orcs, against the orders of Théoden.
Éomer overtakes the Orcs on the border of Fangorn Forest.

Merry and Pippin escape into Fangorn Forest and encounter Treebeard. Éomer and the Rohirrim assault the Orc camp at sunrise and decimate them. Frodo and Sam descend from the Emyn Muil and meet Gollum. Faramir sees the funeral boat of his brother Boromir passing down the Anduin.
The Entmoot commences, and Éomer encounters Aragorn while returning to Edoras.

Frodo, Sam, and Gollum begin the passage of the Dead Marshes at sunrise. In Fangorn Forest, the Entmoot continues, the Three Hunters encounter Gandalf the White; they ride for Edoras. Faramir departs Minas Tirith on an errand to Ithilien.

Frodo, Sam, and Gollum reach the other side of the Dead Marshes. Gandalf, comes to Edoras and heals Théoden. Aragorn, Legolas, and Gimli ride with Théoden and the Rohirrim west to face Saruman. Erkenbrand is defeated in the Second Battle of the Fords of Isen. The Entmoot concludes in the afternoon, and the Ents march to Isengard, reaching it after sunset.
Théoden and his forces retrest to Helm’s Deep, and the Battle of the Hornburg begins at night. The Ents finish the destruction of Isengard.
Frodo, Sam, and Gollum reach the slag-mounds at the bounds of the Desolation of the Morannon. Théoden and Gandalf ride from Helm’s Deep toward Isengard.

Frodo, Sam, and Gollum hide in sight of the Morannon, and depart at sunset. Théoden and Gandalf arrive at Isengard at midday, and parley with Saruman in Orthanc. At night, Pippin gazes into the palantír of Orthanc, the winged Nazgûl flies over their camp at Dol Baran, and Gandalf rides with Pippin for Minas Tirith.
Aragorn is overtaken by the Dúnedain before sunrise. Théoden rides from the Hornburg towards Harrowdale, and Aragorn, Legolas, and Gimli leave later with the Dúnedain.
Frodo, Sam, and Gollum are taken by Faramir to Henneth Annûn. Aragorn and the Dúnedain reach Dunharrow at sunset.
Frodo, Sam, and Gollum head east from Henneth Annûn. Aragorn and the Dúnedain take the ‘Paths of the Dead’ at dawn, and reach Erech at midnight.

Gandalf and Pippin arrive at Minas Tirith. Faramir departs Henneth Annûn. Aragorn and the Dúnedain travels from Erech to Calembel. Frodo, Sam, and Gollum, reach the Morgul-road at sunset. Théoden reaches Dunharrow. Darkness begins to pour out from Mordor.

The darkness of Mordor causes the Dawnless Day. Frodo, Sam, and Gollum pass the Cross-roads, and spy the Morgul-host setting forth. An army from the Morannon captures Cair Andros and movies into Anórien. The Muster of Rohan takes place, and the Rohirrim ride forth from Harrowdale. Faramir, retreating from Osgiliath, is rescued by Gandalf before the Gates of Minas Tirith. Aragorn and the Dúnedain cross the river Ringló.

Gollum visits Shelob, but nearly repents upon seeing Frodo asleep. Denethor sends Faramir to retake Osgiliath. Aragorn and the Dúnedain reache Linhir and cross into Lebennin. Eastern Rohan is invaded from the north, and the First assault on Lórien is made.

Gollum leads Frodo and Sam into Shelob’s lair. Faramir retreats to the Causeway Forts. Aragorn and the Dúnedain, aided by the Army of the Dead, drive the enemy towards Pelargir. Théoden and the Rohirrim camp under Minrimmon, and the Ents defeat the invaders of eastern Rohan.

Frodo is captured by Orcs and taken to Cirith Ungol. The Pelennor is overrun, and Faramir is wounded. Aragorn and the Dúnedain reach Pelargir and capture the Corsair fleet. Théoden and the Rohirrim are led through Drúadan Forest by the Drúedain.
